Recurrent Childhood High-Grade Astrocytomas
							                    When high-grade astrocytoma recurs after treatment, it usually comes back where the tumor first formed. Before more cancer treatment is given, imaging tests, biopsy, or surgery are done to find out if there is cancer and how much there is.    Treatment of recurrent childhood high-grade astrocytoma may include the following:         - Surgery to remove the tumor.    -  High-dose chemotherapy with stem cell transplant.
